info.author: Michael Kluge
info.description: downloads and extracts FASTQ files from the Sequence Read Archive (SRA)
info.paperDescription: Public samples were downloaded from the SRA (accession number: TODO %sraID%) [Leinonen R, Sugawara H, Shumway M, International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration. The sequence read archive. Nucleic Acids Res. 2010;39(Database issue):D19-21.].
info.comments: The SRA toolkit might create a folder named "ncbi" that is located in your home directory.
The command "vdb-config -i" can be used to change this setting for the SRA toolkit.

param.name: sraFile
param.description: path to the *.sra file(s); can not be used in combination with --sraID

param.name: sraID
param.description: one or more SRA ID(s); can not be used in combination with --sraFile

param.name: rename
param.description: new basename for the resulting fastq files;

param.name: outputFolder
param.description: path to folder in which the files should be extracted

param.name: deleteOnSuccess
param.description: deletes the SRA file when extraction was successfull

var.name: isPairedEnd
var.description: true, if paired end data was downloaded from SRA

var.name: baseName
var.description: absolute base name path to the created files

var.name: createdFiles
var.description: absolute path to all files that were downloaded separated by ','
